The Universal Paladin


Image source: https://imgur-.com/xHcy0DM


This is inspired by Empyre's Universal Warrior builds, which is a brillant idea.
Here I make a paladin build draft who can wield any weapon he or she wishes.
I thought it would be fun to go Str 42-> 54, mundane melee AB 47 with any weapon, divine might and shield / undispellable paladin spellbook. 
With divine favor, GMW +5, bless, aid and taunt (-6 AC to certain enemies) that is effective AB 65 with a mundane weapon, 71 with capped Str.
I put expertise in there if one its hitting things ok for extra AC against the mobs with a two handed weapon. 
Also for Maximillan Kane's Expertise/Taunt combination, which I enjoy using, its very simple to execute as well once one practices a little.
I do go Con 8 (buffed by toughness / epic toughness) with all that strength, but if you want more HP Str can be dropped to 38-40.
It still hits 438hp -> 678hp capped. I do like to finish on an even Str modifier due to the way 1.5x damage works with two handed weapons.
Sorc 1 is fabulous to use sorc wands and scrolls if you have access to them, nothing like a good wand of improved invisibility or lesser spell breach...
